meanings.definition: Having a color between black and white
meanings.sent1: The sky on a cloudy day is the grayest I have ever seen.
meanings.sent2: Her cat's fur was the grayest of all the cats in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The grayest pencil in the box seemed to be the most popular among the students.
meanings.sent4: The old castle stood against the grayest sky, looking like a scene from a fairy tale.
meanings.sent5: The grayest clouds rolled in, signaling an impending storm.

meanings.definition: Showing signs of age or wear
meanings.sent1: The grayest book on the shelf had tattered pages and a worn-out cover.
meanings.sent2: His grandfather's grayest sweater was his favorite because it smelled like home.
meanings.sent3: The grayest shoes in the store were so worn that they looked like they had traveled the world.
meanings.sent4: The old house on the corner had the grayest walls, telling stories of years gone by.
meanings.sent5: The grayest tree in the forest stood tall, its branches showing the passage of time.

meanings.sent1: The grayest movie I've ever watched put me to sleep within the first ten minutes.
meanings.sent2: His voice sounded the grayest when he talked about his least favorite subject.
meanings.sent3: The grayest party I attended had no music, no laughter, and no fun.
meanings.sent4: Her expression was the grayest when she heard the boring news.
meanings.sent5: The grayest day of the year seemed to drag on with no end in sight.
